players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the detective.
Night 1 begins.
Bob was found dead.
You investigated Charlie and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.
You: "Charlie is the mafioso. I investigated him last night and confirmed his role. We need to vote him out to win."
Diana: "Alice, if you're the detective, why did you investigate Charlie instead of Bob? Bob was killed, so he wasn't mafia. This doesn't add up."
Charlie: "Diana makes a good point. If Alice investigated me, why not check Bob first? Alice might be lying to frame me."

You: "Diana, I investigated Charlie because detectives don't know who will be killed. I had to pick someone to investigate before the mafia made their kill. Now we know Charlie is mafia - let's vote him out and win!"
Charlie: "Alice, if you're the real detective, why would you investigate me instead of Diana? You'd have no reason to suspect me over her on night one. You're clearly lying to get me voted out."
Diana: "Alice, if you're the detective, why didn't you investigate me? You had no reason to suspect Charlie over me on night one. Your story doesn't hold up."
